name: STAR WARS™: The Force Unleashed™ II
description: The Star Wars® Saga continues with Star Wars®: The Force Unleashed™ II, the highly anticipated sequel to the fastest-selling Star Wars game ever created.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista® SP2, or Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz or AMD Athlon X2 5200+ Memory: 2 GB RAM (XP, Vista, or 7) Hard Disk Space: 10GB + 1GB Swapfile Video: 256 MB Video Memory with Shader 3.0 support; ATI Radeon HD 2600 / NVIDIA GeForce 8600 GT Sound: 100% DirectX 9.0c compatible Audio Device Direct®: DirectX 9.0c (March 2009)
recommended_requirements: Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.8 GHz or AMD Athlon X2 6000+ Video: ATI Radeon HD 4800 / NVIDIA GeForce GTX 260

reviews.review_text: With many years of gaming the one thing I have always known is don’t trust the opinions of critics, this game has had such a bad reputation but it’s not as bad as some people think it is. I really enjoyed it and I watched a lot of YouTube videos saying how bad it was and as my own person I went into it and I enjoyed it.  Way before the times of YouTube and YouTube game critics we had to buy games to see if we liked them or not and hell if you don’t it just sits on the shelf never to be played again, but I don’t understand why most only play 0.8 hours etc and then say it’s a bad game when clearly they have not played it all the way.  I would say to anyone don’t trust others views and go with your own as this game is not as bad as it sounds. 10/10

For some Jedi fun, it was a good game. Short, very short. And it crashed on me after nearly every level, so that was annoying.  I think I liked the first one more, but this one was pretty decent.  Pick it up on sale, it is really not a long game.
This game is simply awesome. Only problem i have with it is it doesn't seem reach 60 FPS
Spectacular and well designed game but the story is quite short. I say its worth buying if you want a few hours of rampage against the Empire
This game blew my gosh darn mind. The story is great and keeps you thinking. It will be an awesome addition to any collection.

The games fun as hell if you're into hack-n-slash ♥♥♥♥, and love Star Wars. Graphics are pretty tight ♥♥♥♥, and playing on hard will get you aggitated with a number of death. BUT FFS WHY IS IT SO SHORT!? The first was a good 7-8 1/2 hours, and thats not playing the extra alternate stories.

Sweet gameplay I love Star Wars action games. Jedi Knight II was one of the firsts games i've played at my life btw.   Targeting system is a little bit screwd but fighting with troopers is fun and gives you a lot of satisfation. I highly recommend to play it. Graphic is quite good, story too.
Its like the first game, but better combat... and only 1/10 as long.
Very underrated game, short story is a full on shame though. Could of been so much more, but hey it is a fun game to pick up for 6 hours and have a blast. Worth a buy!
an excellent intense star wars game all about using the force.

Possibly a great game, graphics spot on along with enviroment and modellling. But it's spoilt by tutorials telling me what o do at the most stupid pf times - my avatar has been kept 'in place' while a tutorial bat appears and has been killed before I could even move him [not the only game guilty of this, but it's damned annoying]. Tried to find where to turn off tutorials but haven't found the link yet.
hours of game play but kinda rinse and repeat

This is a really great game if you can get past the bugs. I have a ton to say about this 2nd installment as I did the first.  pro's -Same as the first one outstanding story and acting. More star wars? totally win! Robot chicken says it best here:         YouTube™ Video:  Robot Chicken: Star Wars Episode III - Force Unleashed Sketch
excellent addition to the starwars cannon lore

I have only recently bought this game for PC, but I have completed it on Xbox 360, and it is a really good simple Star Wars game.   The graphics are absolutely brilliant, especially in the cutscences and cinematics. You can use a variety of spells, and you can upgrade them every time you level up. It gives you a good, easy-to-understand control tutorial, it is dead simple.   This game is worth the price, but you can always wait for the sale, seriously though; get this game, it's really fun to play.

First of all, wait for the sales because it's not really worth the whole price. That being said, I prefered it to the first game. The gameplay is more fluid and the caracter is way more enjoyable to play. There is also a nice graphic improvement. Being more of a beat'em all, it makes the game fun to play as a whole.  It still have many downsides, first of all being the lenght of the game. If you're an average player, you shouldn't need more than 5-6 hours top to beat the game and that's by taking your time. Second biggest flaw is the story. It's dumb and nonsensical from start to finish. So if you are looking for a fun and dumb game whit a lot of action where you can be a badass with a lightsaber (or two), you will probably enjoy it. If you are a fan of the star wars lore or want a deeper, longer game, this is not the game for you (go play KOTOR or something like that).  And most of all, don't pay it full price.

You use the force and kick ♥♥♥! What more can you want out of a star wars game? This game really gives you some free reign to bend the force to your will and be all powerful. If you like the idea of lifting up objects and throwing or using them as you see fit to do whatever you want this is the game for you. I advise playing The Force Unleashed first before jumping into the sequel. They are both great.    Rating 10/10  It's slightly liniar but that will be forgotten fast with the quick action packed levels with plenty of story and carnage along the way.
there is just nothing quite as statsfying as having dual wielded lighsaber as a sequel to a great game it makes it even greater
Good game overall. It's also fun to play whenever you're bored out of your mind.
YouTube™ Video:
I think this game gets a 9.5/10. The combat system was fluent and reliable, my only problem is the game would only reach 90 FPS on my computer! but the game overall was amazing!
More cool features than the first game, but somehow less satisfying. Good game if you want to get your Star Wars kicks on and do some pretty badass stuff.
It's good.
Being a jedi and duel battles with Darth Vader in good graphics, what else you need?!!!
The best hack and slash game I have ever played.
is fun you should play
it's pretty decent.
i whoudent call it the game of the year but it still is awsome all thoe there are so many glitches its still awsome
You know it's good when it is the sequel to the fastest-selling Star Wars game ever created
Just buy it and play it !
surprisingly short but great visuals, combat is solid, and the intro alone is worth the buy.
best star wars game ever
This Game is absolutely amazing! Good graphics, controls, enviroment. The only downside is, they tell you how to do this every time you get to a certain place!

In short, SW: tFU II is like first one but a bit better in terms of combat (only exception is force push... liked it more in previous game). Campaign is awfuly short witch took me 6 hours of gameplay. It's main reason im not shure if i would recommend this game to be bought. If You are a fan of Star Wars go ahead ( i guess :P).  Cheers.
Ignore the ones who say it sucks, if you have a decent computer, it will run good. the game is short, so catch it on sale, but it is awesome.
fantastic game with some of the most realistic saber physics out of all the other star wars games. it is on the short side though. either way. good game.
Got to electricute people like Ms Eagle got hit by lighting yay

Same great action and movie pacing. Continuing the story from the original it seems the direction doesn't know where it wants to go. The game is extremely short and that is disappointing given that the core gameplay is very fun.

Anyone that says it is hard to play this game with a mouse and keyboard is lying. It is a very pretty game with fights that make you feel like a badass. Though it does get a little repetative at times, it is still fun and worth the $5.99 while on sale.

This isn't grade school, boys. The ~50% rating means half people like/dislike it, not that it's a failure. I went into this game with low expectations, it was a lot better then I thought it might be, aside from some issues with screen tearing in a couple cutscenes, physics bugs, and the game disliking my mouse and keyboard, this game was a hell of a lot of fun. But... It's short. if you are looking for a ~4 hour long action packed storm trooper massacre, this game is for you, recommend buying it very cheap on a sale if possible, due to it's disappointing length. 'Sidenote: I have not played the first force unleashed, so I can't make comparisons'.
l;oved the game, but i dunno how to get the bonus dlc mission on endor

Okay, so apparently the first game on here was ported terribly and has a lot of issues (and also doesn't support a controller, which is a must for me), so this game is the best choice of the series on Steam. The story is, yes, incredibly lacking, but does the story really matter for a hacknslash? I would definitely get this game if you're into badass force powers and mauling down waves upon waves of Stormtroopers. If not, and you prefer story, and a good quality of level design, don't get it. But this is an all around fun game that I loved playing and will continue to play.
Great starwars game here, if your looking for your starwars fix then I recomend...
Short but sweet
As many said before, it's very short so it's better to get it from sale when it costs just few euro.   Besides that good and entartaining star wars game that should keep SW fans satisfied.

this game, gameplay wise, is amazing! it has beautiful graphics and amazing light saber gameplay... BUUUUUUUT... it has a painfully short story (4 hours) that doesnt really engage you... so i only recommend it if your a huge starwars fan who has a spare 20 minutes to blow off some steam...
Mechanically better, but significantly shorter, than the first game

For a player who just jumped straight into the 2nd game and not playing from the 1st, I find that the graphics for that time (2010) was well done... not only that but the voice actors did a pretty good job too. One example to tell or prove this fact (my opinion) is how Starkiller's voice is at the start of the game, when he keeps yelling and shouting 'Get away from me!' and 'Leave me alone!'caught me by surprise. You know not all games these days have the same tone to the characters. Currently I am enjoying this game and if you are willing to buy it, then go for it! I would rate this game 7/10.
Good game: Like Kratos meet a lightsaber. Bad pc port: When you hit an enemy, looks like the frames lose stability.
Great game but very short. Nine missions. Still fun though
this game is really awesome but when u play it for a wile it makes u get a update if u dont get it it wont let u play
I don't know why, but it was good game for me

This game is definately a jump from The Force Unleashed. I find myself back adn back again to play and experiment with new force moves. There are definately challenging scenes, and you may find yourself dieing once or twice juts to clear a mob. Overall, great game!

This game was very very easy. I personally loved it. Some big star wars fans may not. If you are playing the game on easy then it will be like you are walking through the park. The only thing that could use some improvement is the lightsaber combos.
Final boss is longer than the story itself

I wouldn't recommend this until it drops to 20 or maybe even lower. Boo hiss. Poorly ported to the PC, not a fan of you when that happens. Released at $40.00, one wonders if this game was a known failure. I got it on a whim and heavily regret it. The game has about 5 different types of encounters... Rinse repeat for the next 12 hours of your life. Ugh... 43/100

This is a seriously short game, so some people might be miffed at its price point. However, for as long as it lasted it was awesome. Star Wars games are known for their excellent production values, but this one takes the cake. It's immersive, emotional, and the action is great.  It's like I was taking part in a really awesome six-hour long movie. The score isn't just inspired by John Williams; it very nearly equals the great man's works. The sheer scale of the game is breathtaking, and there are few experience out there quite like it.  Star Wars fans owe it to themselves to play this, even if the action is over-the-top at times. This isn't the best Star Wars game, but it comes a close third after KotOR and Republic Commando.

This game was very very easy. I personally loved it. Some big star wars fans may not. If you are playing the game on easy then it will be like you are walking through the park. The only thing that could use some improvement is the lightsaber combos.

Great sequal with improvements on the lightsaber stats... Great game although it left with a cliffhanger. Great idea, but the third installment was never put into production.... I did start to notice the 'Grandma's Boy' fix where you basically fight the same monsters, but they are colored different out of the few worlds you fight on, but hey who cares when you can slice your lightsaber into it.
Awesome graphics and good storyline!
A very nice game overall, short story though but fun. But having problems with FPS, it's kinda locked at 60 or below, got kinda sad and scared about that 10/10 would play again.
this game is great

I honestly don't know why so many people hate this game. Yes, it's a port, yes it has some issues running on PC, but not that many and it's not unplayable. Maybe people are expecting Knights of the Old Republic 3 or some damn thing. This, isn't that. I think the director of the game said it best, it's about kicking ♥♥♥ with the Force. It's about actually using the Force in combat to throw a beat down, as apposed to all the stuff we see in the movies, like moving crap and falling really far. How easy to defeat would the droids in the Clone Wars have been if the Jedi were throwing around Force Lightning? Or using Force Grip to crush some droid tanks? How much more exciting would the cartoon and movies have been if the Jedi acted like the Super Heroes they were supposed to be, instead of emotionless droids with glowy sticks that can move and push things?  If you are looking for a RPG with a deep, interesting story, buy KOTOR 1 and 2. If you're looking for a action game where you play as a Jedi, buy Jedi Outcast and Jedi Academy. If you want to kick some serious ♥♥♥ with the Force, and defeat entire armies all by yourself, and show what real warriors who command the Force can do, buy this and Force Unleashed 1.
just 1 day i can play all mission

Shortlived but fun romp with a lot of the systemic flaws in the combat system tweaked (or perhaps I've just gotten more adept at the game). Altogether a much more polished and attractive effort than its predecessor if lacking in depth or complexity.  And yes, the QTEs do become a pain in the bum at a very early stage.
Force fury:  Lightsaber = no arms party  Force lightning = you shot me so suffer the godly lightning Force push = press e for automatic charge
Definitely better than the first one, which I didn't like because it was full of bugs. This one shorter though but much more enjoyable. Visually, the game is awesome, but I didn't like the story.
Will not get past initial Lucas arts animated logo, Please help. I think that the games settings are at max upon default, and that may be why it freezes right away.

In my experience, this game is straight up better than The Force Unleashed in every way except for game length. Coming in at a paltry 4 hours of campaign and totally missing the DLCs that the consoles got, I was still blown away by the massively improved combat, graphics, story direction and the fact that you can dual wield lightsabers. No, there's no explanation why you wield two now, it's just awesome. Because of the length and lack of content, I would recommend you get this game for under $10 if possible. I can still see the average person not enjoying this though so if you played the first one or think the combat looks nice, I'd say play this one.
:_: Make a third for gods sake..........a third
i like it . but starkiller's walk speed is a little slow i wish there was like a setting for how fast u want starkiller to walk wurth it though

I've always been a fan of star wars games. This was a short but good game. I wish the game could have been quite a bit longer. It would be great with a deeper story(seems like they cut out a good amount from Degoba). I really enjoyed the first one and the second one had my hopes up. Overall fun game play. Just way too short. Not sure about replay value. Good game if you are a fan and can get it for cheap. Hopefully with the new star wars movie(2015) we will see more games like this with the epicness that comes with the star wars franchise.
i wish they put some dlc into and made it longer...... still good game
Though the story for this game may be a little lame, its still alot of fun to play.
Very good game, not so good port... If you dont have a console, buy it on steam!

It's fun, the progression is kinda iffy, you get the right skills early and everything is a breeze until mid game where no matter how many holocrons you find the next fight will be difficult. A real downside are the boss battles, they're creative with some fun mechanics but oh boy... THEY-ARE-EFFING-LONG! I'm not kidding the last boss fight took me over an hour counting deaths, my hands hurt after that.  The plot is good but it can't be hard to write a story when you have lasers and lightsabres.  Oh yeah, it crashed several times, sometimes even twice in the same level so make sure you save the game after you're done with a difficult combat.
It is bug-ridden, but turning V-sync off and disabling multiple monitors will make it work really smootly. The graphics are superb and the action is nonstop. A great game if you can buy it on sale.
this is a really cool game
pretty good 10/10

Personally, I only recommend picking up this game if/when it's on sale (I was fortunate enough to pick it up for $3 during the Summer sale). There's definitely fun to be had in this game; the force powers you receive and using your lightsaber are enjoyable and make you feel powerful. However, the gameplay is very repititious and the main campaign is shockingly short. I beat it on medium difficulty in around 5 hours, and the other modes do not add much replayability. This is definitely a one-and-done game.  One thing worth noting is that this game is beautiful. I'm only running an HD4850 at the moment and I was able to max out the settings with antialiasing and a resolution of 1440x900 while maintaining a solid framerate. I found myself taking several moments in-between combat sections just to stop and enjoy the visuals.  If you're looking for some quick action and some eye candy, wait for it to go on sale and pick it up. I don't think it's worth the $20 price tag because it's so incredibly short, but if you get it for less you just might enjoy the ride.
The first one was a great game but this one...  stupid and short story bad graphics too simple power upgrade system and  the final boss... It's been so painful  would buy for 5$ or less

Took me 4 hours to crack the game. Such little game content, and no replayability. Which is almost a good thing because the combat and storyline is so repetitive that if it went on much longer I probably would have given up anyway. The only part of the game that changes due to dark/light side choices in right at the end. All it changes is the final clip.
4 hours

I would not recommend this game even to a Star Wars fan.  While the first Force Unleashed was a mediocre game with some nice phisics and a good story, Force Unleashed II's story is absolutely horrble. It is a pathetic attempt to cash in some more money in the aftermath of the first game's decent success, to cover the huge amount of money invested into the engine and phisics.
Completed in 3 hours, gameplay is repetitive - either spamming attack button or a quick time event. For some reason, some cutscenes didn't load for me, just auto skipped and went to the next level.

I am a Star Wars fan and even as someone who loves this universe and it's lore, I couldn't get myself to like this game.  After playing the first of the two games on I felt compelled to finish the story. The first game had me with it's storyline and pretty fun gameplay. You play a secret disciple to Darth Vader who has a change of heart, but you quickly learn to realize that this storyline and gameplay didn't continue at all into this game. The gameplay does have a little fun to it, once in a while, but it's very lackluster even at the very start. It's very repetitive and just doesn't get you immersed into this character or make you feel very powerful. It feels very choppy and unenjoyable. There's even an instance where you have to bring down a huge Star Destroyer which makes you feel so damn amazing finally, but quickly puts you back to reality once you start trying because the controls and mechanics in which to do so are so obscure that the only way you can find out how to actually complete that part is to youtube the sequence. The mainstory is ridiculously short, I played about 5 hours and finished the entire campaign on Medium, and was easily forgettable.  Pros: - It's a Star Wars game?  Cons: - Gameplay is lackluster - Storyline is lackluster - Campaign is less than 5 hours long - There's an instance in the game where you must google in order to continue  ********* TL;DR ********* Personally, I only recommend picking up this game if/when it's on sale (I was fortunate enough to pick it up for $3 during the Summer sale). This is definitely a one-and-done game, even for all the die hard Star Wars fans out there. It's just a bad game.

Look at my hours. All of those other nerds just played through once. I did everything. EVERYTHING. This game is not worth it. It wasn't worth this much of my time. It wasn't worth the 4 hours it took to beat. The final boss is ♥♥♥♥. The story is ♥♥♥♥. Yoda's appearance is ♥♥♥♥.   Gameplay's fun, mechanically. However, so is World of Warcraft. I don't play that anymore, either.

Wow am I glad I only paid 5$ for this. 1- Short ... way to short for a game this size (in GB) 2- Non existant story 3- Repetitive gameplay 4- Buggy ... the grapple animations work 2/3 of the time and I had darth vader completly wig out and start spinning uncontrolably through a plat form.  This is a bad game with weird difficulty spikes.

crashed over and over.  when i finally got it to work, and got in the game, none of the controls did anything, starkiller just stood there.   my personal favorite star wars game besides kotor 1 & 2, and i lost my copy a long time ago.  pretty ♥♥♥♥ing disappointed that i will probably never play this game again.
Took a while to get it running and the wait and effort was not worth it. Bad in nearly every regard, just a horrid port. A ghostly shell of the previous game.
To be honost the first game was better. Theres no multiplayer like the first one. The moves get repetitive. And the story isnt good compared to the first force unleashed...

Dont get this game. Great Gameplay Looks amazing but all that goes down the toilet when you are playing it and all of a sudden it crashes or your praying to god it doesnt crash while your watching a cut scene.

Even though I got this game on sale for 7 bucks, Its something I greatly regret. This game is one of the worst coded pieces of junk I have ever played. Its a horrible console port. Just getting it to run at all is a huge task. After 30 minutes of researching work arounds on the net, and finally tweaking my system enough to allow the game to even start without crashing, im then met with just absurd amounts of screen tearing (even with vsync), video stutter, flickering 3d objects and textures, and random hitching and slow down. Not to mention, the game is capped at 30 FPS, and the only unlocker hack is being distributed by people who package it with trojans.  What a junk game. Do yourself a favor and find this game on the PS3 if you really want to play it. Lucas Arts deserved to go away if this is the quality of product they were putting out. Lucas should go and slap each and every one of the developers involved in this port.

3 Hours playstime ....... 3 HOURS and I have absolutely no motivation to replay it for what little is left to do - and I 100% Lego Games for crying out loud.  Gamplay is fun in the beginning and the powers are worth experimenting with, for about 10 minutes after you get them
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! NOT WORTH THE COST !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!    Took me 3 hours to beat it the first time then 2 to beat it a second.
i didnt unleash my force 0/10
DONT BUY THIS GAME!!! It is very buggy. the game its self if fun but the bugs in the game are horible dont buy pls just save ur money for something else
3,7 hrs to complete the game,lol. The first one is better, don't buy unless you buy the complete star wars pack like meh.

I would like this game, if it didnt run like crap on a decent gaming laptop. The devs obviously did not care when they ported this game or cared at all when people told them why framerate was in the single digits(it's cause of loose clothing). So yeah this game is hardly enjoyable due to technical problems.

Pro Story follows the first one and fits well, main reason I am playing I got to be Darth Vader before the tutorial in #1 Level up your attacking ability by failing at things, like in dark souls. Con Boss fights are all rhythem games, you have a long cutsceen with random keyboard commands. Level up your HP and force energy by finding hidden cubes. long unskippable cutsceens that I have already seen.

Just wow, it is barely a game. I liked some of the basic combat, but at its core, this 'game' is a 5 hour waste of time. Why in the world would you ever want to play a garbage, unimportant character whom you will dislike entirely. Particularly since the story barely existed at all. There is no adventure, there is no glory, there is just a trumped up platform game where you will wish the protagonist (you) would just give up and die already.

so i got the game i thought i would have my childhood back. now that i have steam and i was literaly WTF there are sme cut scenes that was skipped for no reason and at the end where u get to choose whether to kill vader or not TOO ♥♥♥♥ING BAD it chooses the light side for you and a cutscene crashed at the end this was a waste of money and space in my library i expected good......
This game is not very good.

DO NOT BUY. Crashes on launch or during cut scenes. Check the forums. It's happening to a lot of people, and no one is helping. You're rolling the dice buying this -- could literally just be throwing your money way.
I've only thumbed this down because the story is extremely short and linear, only get if on sale or you are burning money:D
I can haz TWO lightsabers?!?

Capped at 30fps, screen terring even in cutscenes wtih anti aliasing, the original looks better than this on 360, crashed a few times before being able to play it, horrible port, played 7mins instantly wasndissapointed not worth $20 or even $6(what i paid) pls dont buy, you will regret it
Utterly unplayable on the PC. Does not even make it to the title screen before freezing indefinitely.
very very dull and the story is so so so bad one and the graphics are also bad so bad and thats why i stopped playing and eraised it just dont play it dont even think about
too short very poor gameplay. I finished it in 8 hrs
DON'T GET THIS GAME(unless it's less than $5). Pros Graphics are alright.  Cons Very, very repetetive, story is meh, and it's not very fun.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! Totally unplayable. Has no frame rate cap, so it pushes over 4500 frames per second, yes the four thousand five hundred, which causes it to constantly crash during the opening cinematic. Followed some guides posted by other players to do things like force enable VSync via my graphics driver and force other options like Triple Buffering, but those settings cause the audio and video to skip like I'm playing from a scratched disc.  I'm very thankful for STEAM's recent refund policy, but games that are this broken should be removed from the store by Valve.

So Starkiller died at the end of TFU. Wow, what a spoiler for such a great plot! Anyway, you're a clone and you have two lightsabers instead of one. It plays pretty much exactly like the first one, except the lightsabers get little upgrades and there are a few different enemies. Your final objective is still to kill Darth Vader, which you obviously fail regardless. It's chocked full of horrible voice acting and facial animation.  Yep.

in many ways this game is very good, the graphics and gameplay are all very enjoyable and merely tweaked from the first game which was very good, the story is compleing also and i spent quite some time being shouted at to turn it off. unfortunatly despite these good points it is an infuriatingly short game on hard difficulty and i admit dying quite a lot in the middle section of the game it took me just over three hours to complete the whole game. at the end (minor spoliers) you choose a light side/ dark side option and infact i played the whole game through again just incase choosing the other option extended game time in short dont buy this game unless ts very cheap and on sale
yeah, uh, the ♥♥♥♥ is strong with this one.

Didn't think it would be worse than the first game, but I was wrong.  The game is ridiculously short, it took me a total of 4 hours to beat the campaign, and I was not speeding through it (I find it funny that my playtime includes watching the entirety of the credits). The amount of bugs in this game is also insane, even in game cinematics have very obvious bugs. Stormtroopers heads shaking around, Darth Vader walking through the ground, etc. When you see a pre-rendered cinematic having ridiculous bugs, just turn off your pc. There is no vertical sync option and the screen is always tearing so much so that its strange when there isn't a tear. Story is pointless and tacked on, nothing that happens is important, honestly can't even think of anything to say about it, but you will get a few laughs out how awkward it can be. The gameplay isn't even as good or tight as the first (which wasn't good or tight at all), the lightsaber pausing everytime you hit an enemy for a second drove me insane.  The only positive thing I can say about this game is that if you are a Star Wars fanatic like myself you will get a bit of enjoyment out of this. The music of John Williams is never disappointing, and a lightsaber always is fun.  This game is nowhere near $20 value as there is story based DLC for other games that are of more quality and longer than The Force Unleashed II. I honestly feel bad for anyone that paid $60 for it. It's pretty clear that the developer signed a contract saying they needed to make a sequel and had no idea what to do. There are plenty of fantastic Star Wars games that you should spend your time with such as the Jedi Knight or Knights Of The Old Republic series. Even if you have already played those games you will enjoy playing them again for four hours more than you will enjoy beating The Force Unleashed II's campaign.  Still not convinced? Okay lets try this **waves hand** you will not buy this game.  Edit: Just found out that this does not include the DLC for the game, making it even less worth your time & money. :)
Awful. Just awful. Buy the Jedi KNight games and avoid this terrible franchise like the plague.
you're afraid. AFRAID YOU'LL NEVER BE AS STRONG AS FORCE UNLEASHED I!
crash, crash, crash, oh whats that? CRASH

This is not a complete game, it requires browser support since many areas the player will find themself stuck unable to continue. This will require the use of a browser to google to find a walkthrough or a way out. The poor controls will leave you feeling less like a Jedi knight and more like you are a clown.  0/10 Value: 2.50

I got this as a part of the 'Star Wars Humble Bundle' a while back and have only just got around to playing it back to back with its predecesor. All in all, this is a mixed bag of bits. If you have played the previous episode, disappointment will set in rather quickly. Graphically, character animations are much improved from the original, but backgrounds seem to be standard fodder and there is a marked difference in quality of some levels. Sound and effects are satisfying, and the game doesnt suffer the random volume levels of the previous one where background n arration and music would drop out for no reason. Satisfying sound a-la Lucasfilm and Star Wars themes a plenty here.    Gameplay wise however the game falls flat on its face. The game suffers from tedious poor story and level development, making you duplicate the levels backwards in places to act as filler. Camera focus is annoying and often leads you to wish you could pull the camera back just to see what you are doing. in other places, the system, works fine, so its not a complete waste, but it could have been better. All in all, the level design is a bit dull. This wouldnt be too bad if the general tone of the missions was different but monotonous repetitive grinding gets boring after a while.   Although theres are some nice touches (breakable environments, the occasional heroic cutscene as you destroy a big boss (a-la Gods Of War), and your force powers have a decent effect on the enemies and environments, the bad sides of the gameplay spoil what could have been a great game into a mediocre 3rd person lightsaber grind.   Story wise, this is pretty lame. without giving too much away, theres one part that was completely un-necessary and was just there to get you from place a to place b. theres no fluid action in this game. its stop/start 'kill enemies/watch cutscene of new enemies appearing/repeat'. crowbaring other canon characters into the game was stupid as well. its smacks of desparation as the devs just didnt have any ideas and ended up snatching defeat from teh jaws of victory. Frankly, if the devs havent learned how to write a decent game yet and are relying on the star wars name and licence to sell it, its no wonder it is held in such revile by fans of the Star Wars universe.  Recommended for fans of Star wars and people who are that bored that they need a short game to pass a few hours with some utterly ridiculous plot points, but this is lame in comparison to the original and youll porobably never play it again
First one was decent, im not even sure what this is lol

And so every in game movie is a point were the game might potentially freeze. Luckily you can skip the ingame movies if the they freeze and try to watch them later from the menu, Beyond the technical difficulties, it's pretty much the same game as the first Force Unleashed. Fun combat, but extremely short game. The gameplay is also incredibly repetitive, and the story may as well not even be there.  The story felt like it was trying to be one overarching story split up over two games (with, I assume, the second part being delivered via the third game in the series,) kind of like how Empire and ROTJ did it. However, it ended up being more like if A New Hope ended right as the Millennium Falcon is being pulled onto the Death Star. When it ends, it gives you the choice between a light- and dark-side ending; I chose the dark side ending, and it legitimately made me think they ended the game prematurely on purpose to make players choose the light side, (much like how in Arkham City, when you play as Catwoman near the end, you are able to choose to say '♥♥♥♥ batman' and just leave with the jewels, whereupon you are awarded a lame ending and are then sent back to make the cannon-appropriate decision.) Needless to say, I was pretty surprised when after the credits, the game threw me back to the title screen with no option to pick up where I left off.  Moreover, there are really only 3-4 actual levels in the game, all of which, while somewhat distinct from each other, seem to be comprised solely of a few rooms and enemy configurations repeated over and over again until you get to the boss. All of the boss battles are your standard-affair 'exploit weakness until boss falls down, then run in for the kill' type, except they are all artificially lengthened to the point that they get kinda boring.  The combat outside of boss battles is pretty fun, but there isn’t a whole lot of variety in experience or enemy type. You are able to upgrade your powers with exp, but none of the upgrades really made me feel like they had any impact in my overall combat ability. Same goes for the saber crystals.  TLDR: The game wasn’t bad necessarily, but it felt more like a drawn-out expansion of the first game rather than its own distinct entry in the series. The story was dull and didn’t even seem finished, and the gameplay is extremely repetitive. I would recommend passing on this one unless you absolutely loved the first TFU.

Played the first game, enjoyed it greatly.  An hour or so into this and the game is frankly unplayable.   Every cinematic has a 50% chance to crash the game completely (and boy are there a lot of cinematics). Whenever you swing your lightsaber into enemies the FPS drops to rediculous levels. The content this time around feels extremely arcade-repeated, and not in the classic or fun manner.   I am playing on a GTX970, 12gigs of RAM and an i5 processor. This game far outdates these componants and the technical glitches and flaws are too grueling for me to persist with a title I usually would have a lot of time for. 2/10
capped at 30 fps. deal breaker for me. only get it if it's on sale. obvious ♥♥♥♥ console port.

I try to keep track of which games I own / have played / have finished. It took me a while to remember I'd even played Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II, never mind finished it. And that really sums up the game.  Compared to the original Force Unleashed, it's more fun to play, slicker, and has far fewer moments that pretend to be challenging but are actually just annoying (no Purge Troopers here!). But it's also more forgettable, shorter (and yet still repetitive), less rewarding to replay, and the story somehow manages to be tedious despite the short length of the game.  I wouldn't recommend this even if you liked The Force Unleashed. I did, for all its flaws. This sequel does get rid of some of those flaws, but what remains is a scant few hours of disposable and unnecessary cruft. If you need to buy every Star Wars game that exists, then maybe consider this a low priority. I don't  hate  it; I just don't feel much about it at all, on those rare occasions I remember it exists.
It's a good game but it isn't worth $20, there are only 4 levels, wtf. Decent gameplay, ok graphics.   5/10, first one was better
